subject: Investing
title: Expense Ratios Decoded
description: A micro-lesson that makes Expense Ratios Decoded usable.

hook.text: A 0.03% expense ratio means $3 per year for every $10,000 invested. Some funds charge 1% â€” that's $100.

buildup.text: The expense ratio covers management, administration, and legal costs. It's deducted from returns daily.

discovery.text: Vanguard's total market ETF charges 0.03%. The average active fund charges 0.66%. That gap compounds.

twist.text: A 1% fee doesn't sound like much. Over 30 years, it can eat a third of your total returns.

climax.text: Bogle called high fees 'the relentless rules of humble arithmetic.' Math always wins eventually.

punchline.text: Every dollar in fees is a dollar not compounding for you.

quiz.question: How much does a 0.03% expense ratio cost per $10,000 invested annually?
